comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Maybe Clara Kuttroff Cassebeer (1882-1971), wife of Theodore Cassebeer (1879-1941), daughter of Adolph Kuttroff (1846-1936): americanhistory.si.edu/steinwaydiary/annotations/?id=711 www.colorantshistory.org/KuttroffAdolphBiography.html

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: pennylrichardsca: you may be right about who she is, but we will need to investigate this further before we can confirm this.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of March 13, 1918 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10612FC345C10738... reports, "Mrs. Theodore Cassebeer and Miss Caroline Bogart came through to the final of the Pinehurst championship tennis tournament today. " NYT of June 6, 1914 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30A13F73C541273... has her winning a tennis title. She was clearly a successful tennis player for several years. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0C17F63B5B1773... calls her Mrs. Theodore K. Cassebeer -- which supports pennyrichardsca's identification.
